player-join: A happy little bird chirp followed by a squeaky pop, like a chick hatching out of an egg. Cute and welcoming, makes you smile.
player-disconnect: A sad single-note slide whistle going down, like a bird falling off a branch. Goofy and deflating, cartoon-style.
game-start: A flock of excited birds tweeting in unison building into a silly trumpet fanfare, like a kazoo orchestra. Triumphant but dopey, about 1.5 seconds.
bird-flap: A tiny puffy wing flap, soft and feathery like a chubby bird struggling to stay airborne. Think rubber duck crossed with a whoopee cushion, very quick, under 0.2 seconds.
bird-hit: A rubbery cartoon bonk with a wobbly spring boing, like a bird flying into a glass window. Slapstick and silly, followed by tiny tweeting stars.
vfx-shape: A whimsical sparkly whoosh, like a bird casting a silly spell with its wing. Magical but goofy, like fairy dust mixed with a party blower.
vfx-explosion: A big puffy cartoon poof, not a real explosion, more like someone belly-flopping onto a giant bean bag. Over-the-top squishy boom with confetti energy.
smoke-reveal: A big dramatic whoooosh of swirling clouds, like a genie appearing from a bottle but fluffier. Theatrical and comedic, like a magician pulling a rubber chicken from a hat. About 1 second.
question-appear: Dreamy harp glissando with little bird tweet accents, like a thought bubble popping into existence above someone's head. Whimsical and curious.
answers-appear: Four quick bouncy plops in descending pitch, like four eggs dropping into soft nests one by one. Playful and rhythmic, boing-boing-boing-boing.
answer-select: A decisive pecking sound, like a bird confidently tapping its beak on a button. Snappy and satisfying with a little click.
answer-correct: An enthusiastic two-note bird song going up, like a bird doing a happy little victory dance. Bright and rewarding, the sound of a bird who knows things.
answer-wrong: A sad trombone wah-wah but played on a tiny kazoo, like a bird shrugging with its wings. Gently mocking, not mean, just funny and deflating.
timer-tick: A soft woodblock tap, like a bird tapping its foot impatiently on a branch. Minimal and rhythmic, subtly comedic.
timer-warning: Faster anxious pecking sounds with rising pitch, like a panicking bird running in circles. Urgent but funny, cartoon alarm energy.
timer-expire: A cuckoo clock pop followed by a deflating balloon sound, like time ran out and everything went limp. Abrupt and silly.
player-answered: A quick little satisfied cluck, like a hen who just laid an egg. Tiny and proud, a miniature accomplishment sound.
score-point: A bright twinkly ding with a happy bird trill, like collecting a shiny seed. Rewarding and cute, classic game pickup but with bird flavor.
game-over: A dramatic owl hoot transitioning into a silly music-box lullaby, like the birds are all falling asleep on the scoreboard. Finale energy but cozy and funny, about 2 seconds.
